title: Fragment, 16th–17th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic
Technique: supplementary warp forming cut and uncut raised pile on plaineweave (velvet) with supplementary wefts.
provenance: ex. coll. Antonio Vivès y Escudero
description: Interlacing strapwork forming compartments which have a fleur-de-lys motif or an acorn motif. . In blue on gold ground. Right selvage present.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 16th–17th century.
16th–17th century. Medium: silk, metallic
Technique: supplementary warp forming cut and uncut raised pile on plaineweave (velvet) with supplementary wefts.. Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-543.
